section.title: Pre-Install Requirements and Prerequisites
section.para: Ensure that the following requirements have been met before continuing with the install.

section.title: Hardware Requirements
section.para: The &THIS.APPLICATION; doesn't change the &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Hardware Requirements, refer to &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE and &THIS.PLATFORM; USSD gateway documentation for more information.

section.title: Software Prerequisites
section.para: The &THIS.APPLICATION; requires &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE properly set, with &THIS.PLATFORM; USSD gateway deployed.
Note that JSLEE is a runtime requirement. Gateway and container are target for messages forged with &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION;. User can setup different environment to consume messages.

step.title: Downloading the source code

important.para: Subversion is used to manage its source code. Instructions for using Subversion, including install, can be found at

step.para: Use SVN to checkout a specific release source, the base URL is &THIS.RELEASE_SOURCE_CODE_URL;, then add the specific release version, lets consider &THIS.VERSION;.

step.title: Building the source code

important.para: Maven 2.0.9 (or higher) is used to build the release. Instructions for using Maven2, including install, can be found at

step.para: Use mvn to build the binary.
Once the process finishes you should have the simulator binary jar ready. Build process prepares also simulator to run(this includes all dependencies).
